1.verse: A Song of degrees. LORD, remember David, and all his afflictions:

2.verse: How he sware unto the LORD, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;

3.verse: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;

4.verse: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

5.verse: Until I find out a place for the LORD, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.

6.verse: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.

7.verse: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.

8.verse: Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.

9.verse: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.

10.verse: For thy servant David's sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.

11.verse: The LORD hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.

12.verse: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.

13.verse: For the LORD hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.

14.verse: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.

15.verse: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

16.verse: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.

17.verse: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.

18.verse: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
